2,2,page,und,About Us,1,1,1306512515,1432484994,1,0,0,0,0,"

Ferguson Wellman Capital Management is an established investment advisory firm that has managed growth carefully in order to provide the high level of personalized service our clients have expected from us for more than 39 years.
We create and deliver investment strategies, services, communication and education to individuals and institutions.

Since our inception in 1975, Ferguson Wellman has been an independent, employee-owned firm solely dedicated to investment management. Contrary to industry trends, we are committed to maintaining our employee ownership structure, as we believe it best serves our clients and staff.

The prospect of ownership has been a powerful tool for us in recruiting and retaining outstanding professionals who have brought expertise to our firm and continue to identify ways to best serve our individual and institutional clients. Seventy-seven percent of our 43 employees own shares in the firm and six principal owners share firm-wide management responsibilities.
Our principal owners are in their 50s and 60s, providing a stable environment for long-term relationships with clients. There has been no turnover in investment professionals in the last 26 years.

The firm is led by a board of directors and investment professionals who work in a team structure for investment management and client service. Since 2007, a percentage of outstanding shares have been sold between the board of directors and the firm's executive and senior vice presidents. This is an ongoing exchange to transition ownership.

In addition to providing consistent investment management performance, reputable service and comprehensive reporting, many of our employees are active, contributing leaders in communities where we serve clients.

3,3,page,und,Expertise,1,1,1306512552,1432483090,1,0,0,0,0,

Our in-house expertise

As a 100 percent employee-owned firm, we are able to attract and retain professionals who have enabled us to have in-house expertise on creating balanced portfolios and developing a wide range of investment strategies.

Our investment team consists of portfolio managers and analysts who possess an average of more than 24 years of experience. Eight of our professionals have their Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation and nine have completed their MBAs. Other designations our professionals have earned include Certified Financial Planner (CFP), Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst, (CAIA) and Chartered Market Technician (CMT).
Our investment approach

We use individual securities to build diversified portfolios. This enables us to manage the risk of these portfolios specifically to each of our client's risk tolerances and return requirements. Individual securities also afford us the ability to structure portfolios to meet a client's liabilities, cash flow or income needs by limiting the sale of securities to raise cash. This reduces transaction costs to the portfolio.

We start with asset allocation and use multiple asset class strategies to provide competitive returns while reducing volatility (risk). We are active managers of many asset classes, including large-cap domestic equities, international equities (developed markets and emerging markets), real estate investment trusts (REITs) and several fixed income strategies. If appropriate, small-cap equities, private equity and hedge funds are strategies which are outsourced to managers that have been thoroughly vetted by our investment team.

4,4,page,und,Individuals and Families,1,1,1306512585,1432489832,1,0,0,0,0,

For more than 39 years, Ferguson Wellman has helped individuals and families navigate through the complexities of wealth management. We currently serve individual clients in 34 states and work with nearly 100 multi-generational families. Our minimum is $3 million.

We start with establishing clients' goals and objectives to create their investment policy. From there, clients can follow one of two paths. Some will contact us periodically to help them navigate through other financial challenges and opportunities that arise throughout our relationship. Other clients prefer that we guide them through the milestones we anticipate they will face throughout their lives. We call this path our Wealth Management Framework.
Serving individuals and families beyond investment management:
<ul>

column3: Identifying income needs and optimizing after-tax returns
Aggregating value of assets and assessing net worth
Collecting and storing pertinent information in the event of an emergency
Analysis of large purchases and sales
Providing timely communication regarding the economy and capital markets
Offering family members education on savings, investing and retirement
Partnering with professionals to provide seamless service delivery:

column5: Trust services, gifting and charitable vehicle options
Expertise on wealth transition and heritage planning
Best practices on family businesses and foundations

column2: Since the early years, institutions have been a significant segment of Ferguson Wellman's client base. Providing investment strategies for Taft-Hartley plans, foundations, endowments, corporate reserves and health and welfare pensions—Ferguson Wellman has evolved and adapted to the changing needs of institutions.

Whether an institution requires a balanced portfolio or one specific investment strategy, Ferguson Wellman has the in-house expertise and flexibility to accommodate any structure, objectives and goals.

We welcome the opportunity to participate in an RFP process or give a presentation on our investment approach and offerings. With a number of our professionals serving as trustees and investment committee members on various boards, we can offer advice and guidance to any institution undergoing this process for the first time.

column1:
6,6,page,und,Consultants and Professionals,1,1,1306512643,1388533251,1,0,0,0,0,

Many of our clients established their relationship with our firm through consultants and other professionals such as accountants, attorneys, private bankers and custodians.

Serving individuals, families and institutions, we have been hired through RFPs, presentations and meetings, and referrals. We provide prospects with information about our investment expertise and approach; our breadth of investment strategies and services; and sample portfolios and references.
Conversely, we provide clients with recommendations on professionals we have worked with that can help them achieve their needs and goals.
7,7,page,und,Communication,1,1,1306512676,1369423045,1,0,0,0,0,<table border=""0"" cellspacing=""0"" cellpadding=""0"" id=""communications_icons_full"">

8,8,page,und,Wealth Management,1,1,1306514312,1436924719,1,0,0,0,0,

Every client who selects Ferguson Wellman is in a unique place in his or her investing life and is facing different opportunities and challenges. Ferguson Wellman's Wealth Management Framework has the flexibility to provide meaningful investment resources suited to address all of our individual and family clients' needs- today and in the future.

We begin our relationships with clients by becoming acquainted with their investment goals and objectives. These discussions then lead to the creation of their investment policy guidelines. Clients receive web or printed quarterly reports that provide an aggregated, comprehensive presentation of their assets. Please visit ourInvestment Strategies section for more information on the investment vehicles we create, manage and employ in our customized client portfolios.

We encourage clients to meet with their portfolio manager on a quarterly basis to review their assets, answer questions and proactively identify decision-making points clients may face in the short or long term regarding their investments and financial matters.

From there, clients can follow one of two paths. Some will contact us periodically to help them navigate through other financial challenges and opportunities that arise throughout our relationships. Other clients prefer that we guide them through the milestones we anticipate they will face throughout their lives. We call this path our Wealth Management Framework- and all services are included in clients' fees. Some aspects of this framework include:
<ul>

column2: • Identifying income needs and optimizing after-tax returns
• Aggregating value of assets and assessing net worth
• Collecting and storing pertinent information in the event of an emergency
• Providing timely communication regarding the economy and capital markets
• Offering family members education on savings, investing and retirement

column1: We continually assess and review our best practices for serving individuals and families through our wealth management committee, comprising six Ferguson Wellman professionals who lead monthly discussions on how we are meeting our clients' needs.
We also work seamlessly with professional partners we can recommend who provide our clients with:
<ul>

column2: • Trust services, gifting and charitable vehicle options
• Expertise on wealth transition and heritage planning
• Best practices on family businesses and foundations

column1:
9,9,page,und,Family Foundations,1,1,1306514351,1432488953,1,0,0,0,0,

Serving family foundations is founded on Ferguson Wellman's 39 years of experience serving institutions as well as individuals and multi-generational families. Working in partnership with trustees and administrators, we:
<ul>

column3: Establish investment policy guidelines reflecting their goals and objectives
Create and manage investment portfolios designed to foster growth and mitigate risk
Provide investment education programs and resources
Share timely communication about the economy and capital markets through email, publications and videos
Can offer best practices about nonprofit management through our:

column5: Leadership experience in serving on more than 70 boards annually
Professional partner organizations we co-host educational events with for clients

column1: In addition to providing web or printed quarterly reports that provide an aggregated, comprehensive presentation of the foundation's assets, our portfolio managers and analysts meet with trustees and administrators to discuss the portfolio and lead discussions on any investment topics that are needed.

Ferguson Wellman also assists individuals and families who have not yet established a foundation. Through our experience and relationships with expert organizations, we navigate clients through the decision-making process and provide analysis on the most relevant and effective charitable vehicle options.

138,138,page,und,Investment Services,1,1,1311361040,1432488780,0,0,0,0,0,

We've all heard the saying, ""You don't know where you're going unless you know where you've been.""ù We believe this not only applies to our investment approach, but also how we manage and grow our firm.

The history of Ferguson Wellman is important to our employees as it provides clarity on important issues for us. From continually improving our client service to making strategic decisions on investment strategies we create or employ -- our approach is linked to our past.

In 1975, our founders Joe Ferguson and Norb Wellman set forth to create a company that was going against the tide of our industry. In a time of mergers, acquisitions and consolidation, they believed in taking a hands-on approach to investing and portfolio management. Advances in technology in the 1970s were starting to make firms bigger and faster. Although this created opportunties and efficiencies for companies, Joe and Norb were mindful of how these developments impacted client relationships. They believed in growing Ferguson Wellman methodically and intentionally. Being too aggressive could result in losing sight of the service and customization that clients valued.

Today, our founders' vision is carried forth by our principals, next generation of leadership and other employees serving our clients through their own area of expertise. Our mission, Investment Excellence; Lifelong Relationships, guides our work for our clients.

139,139,page,und,Communication and Education,1,1,1311361341,1433275540,0,0,0,0,0,

Over the years, we have shared our investment expertise with clients as they identify and achieve their goals. In working closely with clients, we have established an institutional understanding of the challenges and needs they face over the years. This process has enabled us to establish some best practices in working with individuals, families and institutions. We are stronger today because we are meeting our clients' current needs ""Ó and anticipating what they may seek from us tomorrow.

Our Investment Services are a reflection of those client experiences, resulting in analytical and planning resources that create choices for clients based on various scenarios. Working side-by-side with clients, portfolio managers pair this analysis with their expertise on a wide range of investment and financial matters. We also partner with various organizations and professionals to get the answers individuals or trustees need to make the most informed decisions.

If you are an individual or family client, please visit our wealth management section. Large institutions, businesses and nonprofits can refer to our institutional management page for more details on our Investment Services.

140,140,page,und,Institutional Management,1,1,1311361584,1433276146,0,0,0,0,0,

Similar to how we tailor investment portfolios, we also customize the ways we share important information with our clients. We deliver information about client portfolios, changes from our Investment Policy Committee and timely perspectives on the economy and capital markets in the manner most convenient for each client.

We also believe that education is a powerful tool in building strong relationships. Based on our clients' understanding of investments and interests, we provide resources that generate more questions and conversations about their investments and other financial matters.

From our blog to our quarterly reporting and periodicInvestment Strategy Update emails to our quarterly Market Letter publication and Outlook Strategy videos, we believe that the more informed our clients are, the more confident they are in their decision making and our investments.

If you are an individual or family client, please visit our wealth management section. Large institutions, businesses and nonprofits can refer to our institutional management page for more details on our Communication and Education.

141,141,page,und,Investment Strategies,1,1,1311366245,1433273969,0,0,0,0,0,

Ferguson Wellman offers investment strategies for the specific needs that an institution requires in their portfolio.
For more than 39 years, we have served a wide range of institutions that include:
<ul>
Working with a consultant or a board of trustees, we are tasked with managing a specific investment strategy or a balanced portfolio.

column2: In addition to developing or adhering to an institution's investment policy guidelines, clients seek our expertise in:

column1: <ul>

column3: Determining and regularly reviewing asset allocation strategy
Developing short- and long-term plans and cash flow/operating fund contingencies
Educating boards and trustees in investment issues
Connecting nonprofits with community and philanthropic resources
Providing institutional knowledge and guidance for new trustees
Analyzing past market activity and forecasting future trends
Committing to shared values in relation to community involvement

column1: Our expertise and experience stems from more than three decades of managing assets for institutions and we have had no turnover on our investment team for 26 years. We stay apprised of the changing needs of institutions through leadership roles on more than 70 boards and investment committees our professionals serve on annually. In addition, five professionals comprise our investment services committee, which meets monthly to review and update best practices for serving our institutional clients.

column2: If you are in the early stages of developing an investment search process, we can provide you with some sample RFPs to help you design a proposal process to best meet your needs.

column1: If you are considering a change in you investment manager, we can provide information to your CFO, trustees or consultant about our investment expertise, process and performance. Understanding our approach to investment management may help you find clarity about any changes you may be considering.
Please visit our Investment Strategies page for more information on specific investment vehicles we've created and manage.

142,142,page,und,Professional Partners,1,1,1311366864,1370304209,0,0,0,0,0,

Ferguson Wellman's comprehensive suite of investment strategies is exclusively designed for our individual and institutional clients. The strategy we craft for each asset class is mindful of how much risk we are willing to assume in exchange for an anticipated return. Each portfolio manager shoulders the responsibility for appropriately balancing the expected risk, reward and correlation of each asset employed in accordance with the circumstances of each client. Whether the client seeks a balanced, equity-focused, or fixed income portfolio, Ferguson Wellman tailors the core strategies for every client. For more in-depth information about our investment strategies click on the links below.

143,143,page,und,Assets Under Management,1,1,1311367048,1433273692,0,0,0,0,0,

Ferguson Wellman's approach to investment management is very specialized in our industry. Although our core business is investment management using individual securities to build customized portfolios – our client service capabilities have grown over the years. Other areas in which clients utilize our expertise are through our Investment Services and Communication and Education.

Beyond these services, clients seek our advice on other issues, such as taxes, estate planning, private banking, real estate investments, capital campaigns, gifting and organizational issues facing institutions, family business and foundations.

Often we refer clients to trusted professionals we have worked with over the years. Together we work seamlessly to provide our individual and institutional clients with the expertise and experience that can help in their planning and decision making process.
Please refer to our Consultants and Professionals section for more information about working together to serve your clients.

144,144,page,und,Assets By Client Type,1,1,1311367456,1433273713,0,0,0,0,0,

Since 1975, our assets under management have grown consistently due to new clients, transfer of assets and market growth. In the past decade, the equity markets have worked against growing assets; however, we currently are experiencing a trajectory of growth for our firm and our clients since the market lows of 2008.
Updated annually -- as of 12/31/14

145,145,page,und,Professional Referrals,1,1,1311368088,1433275878,0,0,0,0,0,

Diversification in the types of clients we serve was an intentional strategy for accomplishing three goals. First, it gives us the opportunity to employ investment strategies and services needed by one client type to another. For example, our expertise in serving large institutions has given individuals and families confidence in our capabilities. Conversely, many investment communication resources and education programs we designed for individuals have become valuable to institutions- particularly to foundations and endowments. Second, through diversification, our clients have benefitted from the stability of having a range of revenue sources for the firm.

Lastly, our various client types have supported our ""word-of-mouth""ù strategy for growth. Based on our performance and client service, trustees have referred individuals to us. Also, we have been introduced to many institutions through our individual clients. We believe the best referrals we can receive are from those who have worked directly with us- personally or professionally.
Updated annually -- as of 12/31/14

If you are an individual or family client, please visit our wealth management section. Large institutions, businesses and nonprofits can refer to our institutional management page for more details on our Communication and Education.

161,161,page,und,Core-Plus Fixed Income,1,1,1311699468,1436886146,0,0,0,0,0,

Ferguson Wellman offers investment strategies for the specific needs that an institution requires in their portfolio.
For more than 39 years, we have served a wide range of institutions that include:
<ul>
Working with a consultant or a board of trustees, we are tasked with managing a specific investment strategy or a balanced portfolio.

column2: In addition to developing or adhering to an institution's investment policy guidelines, clients seek our expertise in:

column1: <ul>

column3: Determining and regularly reviewing asset allocation strategy
Developing short- and long-term plans and cash flow/operating fund contingencies
Educating boards and trustees in investment issues
Connecting nonprofits with community and philanthropic resources
Providing institutional knowledge and guidance for new trustees
Analyzing past market activity and forecasting future trends
Committing to shared values in relation to community involvement

column1: Our expertise and experience stems from more than three decades of managing assets for institutions and we have had no turnover on our investment team for 26 years. We stay apprised of the changing needs of institutions through leadership roles on more than 70 boards and investment committees our professionals serve on annually. In addition, five professionals comprise our investment services committee, which meets monthly to review and update best practices for serving our institutional clients.

column2: If you are in the early stages of developing an investment search process, we can provide you with some sample RFPs to help you design a proposal process to best meet your needs.

column1: If you are considering a change in you investment manager, we can provide information to your CFO, trustees or consultant about our investment expertise, process and performance. Understanding our approach to investment management may help you find clarity about any changes you may be considering.
Please visit our Investment Strategies page for more information on specific investment vehicles we've created and manage.

162,162,page,und,Intermediate Fixed Income,1,1,1311699669,1436886202,0,0,0,0,0,

Ferguson Wellman's comprehensive suite of investment strategies is exclusively designed for our individual and institutional clients. The strategy we craft for each asset class is mindful of how much risk we are willing to assume in exchange for an anticipated return. Each portfolio manager shoulders the responsibility for appropriately balancing the expected risk, reward and correlation of each asset employed in accordance with the circumstances of each client. Whether the client seeks a balanced, equity-focused, or fixed income portfolio, Ferguson Wellman tailors the core strategies for every client. For more in-depth information about our investment strategies click on the links below.

163,163,page,und,Municipal Bonds,1,1,1311699873,1436886462,0,0,0,0,0,

Ferguson Wellman's approach to investment management is very specialized in our industry. Although our core business is investment management using individual securities to build customized portfolios – our client service capabilities have grown over the years. Other areas in which clients utilize our expertise are through our Investment Services and Communication and Education.

Beyond these services, clients seek our advice on other issues, such as taxes, estate planning, private banking, real estate investments, capital campaigns, gifting and organizational issues facing institutions, family business and foundations.

Often we refer clients to trusted professionals we have worked with over the years. Together we work seamlessly to provide our individual and institutional clients with the expertise and experience that can help in their planning and decision making process.
Please refer to our Consultants and Professionals section for more information about working together to serve your clients.

164,164,page,und,Contact Us,1,1,1311701636,1369418762,0,0,0,0,0,

Since 1975, our assets under management have grown consistently due to new clients, transfer of assets and market growth. In the past decade, the equity markets have worked against growing assets; however, we currently are experiencing a trajectory of growth for our firm and our clients since the market lows of 2008.
Updated annually -- as of 12/31/14

207,207,page,und,Tactical Assets,1,1,1312906971,1315609553,0,0,0,0,0,

Diversification in the types of clients we serve was an intentional strategy for accomplishing three goals. First, it gives us the opportunity to employ investment strategies and services needed by one client type to another. For example, our expertise in serving large institutions has given individuals and families confidence in our capabilities. Conversely, many investment communication resources and education programs we designed for individuals have become valuable to institutions- particularly to foundations and endowments. Second, through diversification, our clients have benefitted from the stability of having a range of revenue sources for the firm.

Lastly, our various client types have supported our ""word-of-mouth""ù strategy for growth. Based on our performance and client service, trustees have referred individuals to us. Also, we have been introduced to many institutions through our individual clients. We believe the best referrals we can receive are from those who have worked directly with us- personally or professionally.
Updated annually -- as of 12/31/14
